sheet-roll-modifier-option-desc: Select the modifier option to use when clicking a dice roll icon on the character sheet.
sheet-chat-roll-dislpay-option-desc: Select how rolls are display in chat window. Private Skill Levels deprecated will default to private, since it doesn't work with rolltemplates.
sheet-chat-roll-types-dislpay-option-des: Select how rolls are display in chat window. Custom rolls requires an API script that can work with the roll template.
roll-option-macro-desc: Enter a macro to run when a skill button is clicked.
sheet-basic-speed-button-option-desc: Select how the basic speed button is displayed in chat window.
sheet-enter-unspent-points-desc: If checked, show text box for unspent points. If unchecked, unspent points is calculated from Total Points text box.
sheet-use-malfunction-desc: If checked, rolltable will check for malfunction.
sheet-damage-dice-icon-desc: Select icon to use for damage dice.
sheet-attribute-mods-option-desc: Select option on how to apply modifications to attributes.
sheet-critical-successes-option-desc: Select option to determine critical success on a skill roll on rolltemplates.
sheet-show-minimum-damage-type-notes-des: If checked, minimum damage type notes will be added to the damage roll table.
sheet-show-damage-type-notes-desc: If checked, damage type notes will be added to the damage roll table.
sheet-damage-type-note-spec-desc: Enter notes for Special damage type.
sheet-penalty-per-spell-on-desc: Enter a negative integer for the penalty.
sheet-show-casting-details: Show casting details on roll template:
sheet-show-casting-details-desc: If checked, detailed notes like casting time, duration, cost, maintain, resisted by, and class will be shown on the roll results template.
sheet-point-summary-layout-option-desc: Select option on how to display the Point Summary Table.
sheet-show-old-techniques-desc: If checked, original techniques table will be visible.
sheet-show-new-techniques-desc: If checked, revised techniques table will be visible.
sheet-show-raw-defense=notes-desc: If checked, show Rules as Written (RAW) for Active Defense success/fail notes.
sheet-style-desc: Select a visual style for the character sheet.
max-skill-9-tooltip: The effective skill cannot exceed 9. Such as a wild swing or not being able to see your target.
night-vision-tooltip: This value negates darkness penalties, except for total darkness. See B71.
dark-vision-tooltip: If checked, Dark Vision negates all darkness penalties. Can see using some other means than light, radar, or sonar. See B47.
high-pain-threshold-tooltip: If checked, High Pain Threshold negates all shock penalties and reduces pain penalties. See B59.
low-pain-threshold-tooltip: If checked, Low Pain Threshold doubles shock and pain penalties. See B142.
hit-location-type-tooltip:
Use the drop-downs to select a hit location or enter a value manually. See B552-555.
Humanoid Low Tech, see LT100-103.
Martial Arts, see MA137.
grapple-tooltip: Grapple halves to-hit penalty. See B370 for more information.
has-shield-tooltip:
If limb is behind a sheild, double the hit location penalty. See B552.
Can be applied to arm, leg, foot, pincer, wing, or tail.
chinks-in-armor-tooltip:
Target chinks in the armor for the hit location. See B400.
-8 to torso, -10 to other locations. DR is halved.
NOTE: will not be applied if grappling.
light-cover-tooltip: Shooting through light cover is -2 to hit. See B548
target-prone-tooltip: If target is crouching, kneeling, sitting, or lying down, apply -2 to hit torso, groin, or legs. See B548
partly-exposed-tooltip: Target or hit location is partly exposed, add an additional -2 to hit. See B548
intervening-figures-tooltip: Enter the number of intervening figures between you and your target, penalty is -4 per figure. See B548
step-attack-tooltip:
Attack, see B365.
Movement: Step
Active Defense: Any
step-feint-tooltip:
Feint. Contest of melee weapon skills, defender is at -1 defense per point you win by. Lasts one second!
Movement: Step
Active Defense: Any, but if you parry with unbalanced, you may not attack.
See B365
move-attack-tooltip:
During or after your move, make a single, poorly aimed attack – either unarmed or with a ready weapon.
Max skill of 9.
Movement: normal, but -2 to avoid obstacles
Active Defense: Dodge or Block
See B365-366
move-wild-tooltip:
Move and Wild Swing! During or after your move, make a single, wild swing/thrust – either unarmed or with a ready weapon.
Max skill of 9.
Melee attack to your side, back, or unseen target. If visibility penalty is higher, use that penalty instead, do not use this one. Roll hit location randomly! See B388-389
Movement: normal, but -2 to avoid obstacles
Active Defense: Dodge or Block
See B365-366
move-slam-tooltip:
End your move with a slam. If using shield, add your shield's Defense Bonus to your damage roll.
Movement: normal, but -2 to avoid obstacles
Active Defense: Dodge or Block
See B371-372
flying-tackle-tooltip:
End your move with a flying tackle, get 1 yard of extra movement and you become prone. At least two legs and one free arm. Can use Jumping to hit target.
Movement: normal, but -2 to avoid obstacles
Active Defense: Dodge or Block
See B371-372
pounce-tooltip:
As slam, get 1 yard of extra movement. Roll DX, Acrobatics, or Jumping to avoid falling prone. Must have at least four legs.
If a mount, rider must roll Riding-4 or fall off!
Movement: normal, but -2 to avoid obstacles
Active Defense: Dodge or Block
See B371-372
no-all-out-attack-tooltip: No All-Out Attack, select this to clear all-out attack option.
all-out-attack-determined-tooltip:
Determined: Make a single attack at +4 to hit!
Movement: half-move, forward only
Defense: None. See B365
all-out-attack-double-tooltip:
Two attacks against a single foe! Two ready weapons or one weapon that doesn't need to be readied after an attack. Apply handedness for 2nd weapon.
Movement: half-move, forward only
Defense: None
See B365
all-out-attack-feint-tooltip:
Feint and attack a single foe! Contest of melee weapon skills, defender is at -1 defense per point you win by. Lasts one second!
Movement: half-move, forward only
Defense: None
See B365
all-out-attack-strong-tooltip:
Single ST-based attack for +2 to damage or +1 damage per die!
Movement: half-move, forward only
Defense: None
See B365
posture-tooltip: Your posture when attack was made. See B547.
evaluate-tooltip:
Evaluate a visible target that you can melee attack.
+1 to hit per turn.
Movement: Any
Defense: Any, doesn't spoil evaluate
See B364-365.
deceptive-strike-tooltip:
Deceptive strike. Every -2 to hit defender is at -1 to active defenses.
NOTE: Effective skill can't go below 10! See B369-370.
wild-swing-tooltip: Melee attack to your side, back, or unseen target. If visibility penalty is higher, use that penalty instead, do not use this one. Max skill of 9. Roll hit location randomly! See B388-389
rapid-strike-tooltip: Make two attacks at -6 each, you may attack multiple opponents. You must have a ready weapon. If you have more than one attack, like all-out attack double, you can replace one of the attacks with rapid strike. See B370
rapid-strike-master-tooltip: Trained by a Master or Weapon Master. Make two attacks at -3 each, you may attack multiple opponents. You must have a ready weapon. If you have more than one attack, like all-out attack double, you can replace one of the attacks with rapid strike. See B370 and B547
flurry-of-blows-tooltip: Flurry of Blows for 1 FP per attack. Similar to Rapid Strike, you make two attacks at -3 each, you may attack multiple opponents. You must have a ready weapon. If you have more than one attack, like all-out attack double, you can replace one of the attacks with rapid strike. Can't be combined with Mighty Blow. See B370
attack-from-above-tooltip:
Roll contest of Stealth vs Vision (-2 if not looking up).
If you win, target is surprised and gets No defense and may freeze.
If you lose, target is at -2 defense.
If target is aware they could use stop-thrust.
You suffer falling damage, but can use skills to offset distance.
Optional attack: do falling damage to target.
See B400
mighty-blow-tooltip: Mighty Blow does extra damage for 1 FP per attack. ST-based attack for +2 to damage or +1 damage per die! Can't be combined with Flurry of Blows. See B357.
height-difference-tooltip: If you and your foe are at different levels, the vertical distance affects combat. See B402
defense-improvised-weapon-tooltip: NOTE: Dungeon Fantasy: if parrying with an improvised weapon, apply a penalty. See DF Exploits-37
defense-hidden-weapon-tooltip: NOTE: From Dungeon Fantasy. If attacked by a hidden weapon, you're at -2 to your first defense. See DF Exploits-58
backstab-tooltip: NOTE! from Dungeon Fantasy. At start of combat, make Stealth roll. If successful, get backstab bonus. See DF Exploits 57-58
tactics-tooltip:
NOTE! from Dungeon Fantasy. A teammate spends turn to observe and advise you. If accepted, roll friends tactics.
Success: +1 hit
Critical Success: +2
Fail: -1 hit
Critical Fail: -2 hit
See DF Exploits 57.
single-dual-weapon-tooltip:
Select your hand and if you're using a dual weapon attack (see B417).
NOTE: Don't use off-hand if you have ambidexterity.
off-hand-training-tooltip:
Off-Hand weapon training. Negates the penalty for using an off-hand weapon.
NOTE: A better approach is adding off-hand attacks to your combat table.
See B232
dual-weapon-training-tooltip:
Dual-Weapon training. Negates the penalty for using a dual-weapon.
NOTE: A better approach is adding dual-weapon attacks to your combat table.
See B230
mounted-description: When mounted, use lower value of Weapon or Riding Skill. See B397
riding-skill-difference-tooltip:
The difference between your riding skill and weapon skill.
NOTE: You could place an attack on the melee table and use riding skill instead of melee weapon skill.
mount-attacked-tooltip: If mount attacked on its last turn, you're at -2 to hit. See B397
mount-velocity-tooltip:
If mount's relative velocity to target is 7, apply +1 damage, -1 to hit.
NOTE: Lances have special damage rules.
See B397
ranged-move-attack-tooltip: Attack with a ranged weapon while moving, aiming is not possible and you lose previous aiming. -2 to hit or bulk penalty, whichever is worse. Movement: normal, but -2 to avoid obstacles. Active Defense: Dodge or Block. See B365-366
ranged-all-out-attack-determined-tooltip: All-Out Atttack Determined: Make a single attack at +1 to hit! Movement: half-move, forward only. Defense: None. See B365
ranged-all-out-attack-suppression-fire-t: All-Out Attack Suppression Fire. Take entire turn to spray an area with automatic fire RoF 5+, see Suppression Fire B409! Movement: half-move, forward only. Defense: None. See B365
in-close-combat-tooltip: If using ranged weapon in close combat, apply a penalty equal to the weapon's bulk rating. See B391
damaged-weapon-tooltip: Penalty to hit based on amount of damage done to weapon last turn. See B548
strength-difference-tooltip: Strength is below that required for weapon, -1 per point of deficit. See B548
moving-mount-vehicle-tooltip:
Attacking from moving mount or vehicle.
NOTE:If not stabilized, the total of Accuracy, Aim, Bracing, and Targeting systems can't exceed vehicle's stability rating (SR). See B469 and B548
vehicle-conditions-tooltip: What conditions is the vehicle experiencing. See B548.
over-under-mount-tooltip: If you're an exposed rider hanging from side of mount/vehicle, penalty to hit is -6 to shoot over or under the mount.
vehicle-dodged-tooltip: Vehicle/mount dodged last turn and you're not the operator. See B548
failed-control-roll-tooltip: Vehicle/mount failed control last turn. Penalty equal to margin of failure. See B548
check-target-tooltip: Opportunity Fire, check target before shooting. See B390.
watch-area-tooltip:
Oppurtunity fire, watch hexes in an area or line of hexes in your line of sight.
Watched area must be within your arc of vision.
NOTE: You can Aim and Wait on a single hex! Aiming is not allowed for more more than 1 hex watched.
See B548
accuracy-bonus-tooltip: Enter Accuracy Bonus of weapon. Only apply if aimed for 1 turn OR you're a gunslinger (see B58). See B364.
aiming-bonus-tooltip: After the initial aim, you can get an additional aim bonus. See B364
braced-tooltip:
If you haven't moved and aimed a turn, you may get the braced bonus.
Firearm/crossbow must rest on a sandbag, low wall, car, etc.
One-handed firearm is braced if using two hands.
Two-handed is braced if you're prone and using a bipod. See B364.
pop-up-tooltip:
Allows you to emerge from cover, move no more than one hex, make a ranged attack, and return cover.
Possible with thrown weapon, firearm, or crossbow.
You are susceptible to opportunity fire, only dodge is allowed. See B390.
targeting-systems-description:
Combined totals from all targeting systems can't exceed weapon's base Accuracy. See B364
If an unstabilized weapon mount, max bonus can't exceed vehicle's Stability Rating. See B469.
laser-sight-tooltip:
Laser sight gives +1 to hit.
NOTE: If target can see aiming dot, they got +1 dodge! See B412
scope-bonus-tooltip:
If aiming, you get an additional hit bonus up to the scope's bonus level.
Fixed scopes, you must aim at least as many turns as the scope's bonus to get the bonus.
See B412
vehicle-targeting-tooltip: Vehicle targeting system bonus if shooter took time to aim. See B469
stability-rating-tooltip: Vehicle's stability rating. Affects Targeting Systems.
unstabilized-tooltip: The vehicle's weapon is not stabilized. The max bonus from Targeting Systems can't exceed Stability Rating of the vehicle. See B469
range-speed-tooltip: Enter the range of target and factor in relative speed if target crosses path of shooter. See B372.
used-to-blindness-tooltip: If used to blindess, the max Visibility penalty is -6. See B124 and B394.
all-out-defense-increased-tooltip: On your turn, you chose to do an all-out defense. Get +2 one active defense. See B366
all-out-defense-double-tooltip: Apply two different active defenses against the same attack. If you fail your defense, you may try a second, different defense against that attack. See B366
moved-attacked-tooltip: If you moved and attacked on your last turn, you can only dodge or block, parry is not allowed. See B366
defense-crawling-tooltip: If you're crawling or lying down, -3 to defense. See B549
defense-kneeling-tooltip: If you're kneeling or sitting, -2 to defense. See B549
retreating-dodge-tooltip: Retreating defense, move away from attacker, at least one yard or up to your step. See B377
retreating-block-parry-tooltip: Retreating block or parry. Move away from attacker, at least one yard or up to your step. See B377
retreating-parry-tooltip:
If using Boxing, Judo, Karate, or any fencing skill, you can get a +3 retreating bonus.
Move away from attacker, at least one yard or up to your step. See B377
defense-nauseated-tooltip: If nauseated, you're at -1 to defend. See B428
acrobatic-dodge-success-tooltip: If you made a successful acrobatic/aerobatic roll, get +2 to dodge. See B375
acrobatic-dodge-failed-tooltip: If you failed your acrobatic/aerobatic roll, you're at -2 to dodge. See B375
dodge-drop-tooltip:
Only against ranged attacks, drop to the ground and become prone.
Any cover you get does not count against the initial attack.
NOTE: Flying or Swimming is possible but only if a step would take you below concealing terrain. See B377
feverish-defense-tooltip: Feverish defense, spend 1 FP to increase active defense by 2. See B357
offhand-parry-tooltip: Off-Hand weapon parry is at -2. See B549
number-of-parries-tooltip: You can more parry more than once per turn, but each additional parry is at a -4 penalty. See B376
number-of-parries-master-tooltip: If you're Trained by a Master or a Weapon Master, penalties are halved. See B376
attack-from-behind-tooltip: Normally, if attacked from behind, you have no defense. However, if you have Peripheral Vision you can defend at -2. See B391
runaround-attack-tooltip: Runaround Attack! Your foe starts in front of you and runs behind you and attacks from behind. You can defend at -2. See B391
grappled-dodge-tooltip: NOTE! from Dungeon Fantasy. If grappled, you're at -1 to dodge. See DF Exploits 41
grappled-block-tooltip: NOTE! from Dungeon Fantasy. If grappled, you're at -2 to block/parry. A grappled limb can't use block/parry. See DF Exploits 41
stunned-tooltip: If you're stunned, defend at -4. See B420
encumbered-tooltip: Penalty equal to your encumbrance is applied to Dodge, Judo, Karate, or any fencing Parry. See B549
skill-encumbered-tooltip:
Penalty equal to your encumbrance is applied to your skill.
Example: Climbing, Judo, Karate, Fencing Weapons, Stealth.
cant-see-attacker-tooltip: If you can't see the attacker you're at -4 to defend. A block or parry requires Hearing-2. See B549
trident-dodge-tooltip: NOTE: From Dungeon Fantasy. -1 to dodge a trident. See DF Exploits-97
trident-block-tooltip: NOTE: From Dungeon Fantasy. +1 to block or parry a trident. See DF Exploits-97
parrying-knife-tooltip:
If parrying with a knife or dagger is -1. See B548
Suggestion: Add the modifier to your defense skill instead of using this checkbox.
parrying-kusari-tooltip:
If parrying with a kusari or whip is -2. See B548
Suggestion: Add the modifier to your defense skill instead of using this checkbox.
parrying-staff-tooltip:
If parrying with a staff you get +2. See B548
Suggestion: Add the modifier to your defense skill instead of using this checkbox.
defense-bonus-tooltip:
Apply the defense bonus of a shield, cloak, spell (B252), or Meta-trait (Supers34). See B374
Shield/Cloak: Used against attacks from front or from your shield side. Can't be used against firearms unless you're using the Damage to Shields option.
Shield Spell: Protects from frontal attacks and is cumulative with a normal shield.
shield-defense-bonus-tooltip: Apply defense bonus for a shield if attack came the front or from your shield side. See B374.
magic-defense-bonus-tooltip: Magical Defense Bonus, such as the Shield spell, which protects from frontal attacks. See B252.
general-defense-bonus-tooltip: A general defense bonus, such as the Supers Meta-trait (see Supers B34), force field, etc.
unarmed-parry-tooltip: Unarmed parry vesus a weapon is -3, unless it's a thrust or you are using Judo or Karate parry. See B548
defense-laser-sight-tooltip: If you can see the laser sight, you get +1 to Dodge. See B548
against-deceptive-attack-tooltip: You're at -1 to defense for every -2 the attacker took to their to hit modifier. See B369
against-dual-weapon-tooltip: If both attacks hit you, you're at -1 to defend. See B548.
parry-flail-tooltip:
If parrying against a flail, you're at -4 to defend. See B405.
NOTE: You can't parry flails with a fencing weapon.
parry-nunchaku-tooltip:
If parrying against a nunchaku, you're at -2 to defend. See B405.
NOTE: You can't parry flails with a fencing weapon.
block-flail-tooltip: If blocking against a flail, you're at -2 to defend. See B405.
block-nunchaku-tooltip: If blocking against a nunchaku, you're at -1 to defend. See B405.
parry-thrown-weapon-tooltip: Parry -1 against thrown weapon. See B549
parry-thrown-small-weapon-tooltip: If the thrown weapon is 1 pound or less, parry is -2. See B549
feint-attack-tooltip: You're at a penalty equal to the attacker's margin of victory. See B365
coughing-sneezing-iq-tooltip: -1 to IQ and IQ-based skills. Can't use Stealth. See B428.
coughing-sneezing-dx-tooltip: -3 to DX and DX-based skills. Can't use Stealth. See B428.
drowsy-tooltip: -2 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls. Make a Will roll every two hours you're inactive to avoid falling asleep. See B428.
tipsy-tooltip: -2 to DX and IQ and -2 self-control rolls except to resist Cowardice. Reduce Shyness by one level. See B428.
drunk-tooltip: -2 to DX and IQ and -4 self-control rolls except to resist Cowardice. Reduce Shyness by two levels. See B428.
euphoria-tooltip: -3 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls. See B428.
pain-level-tooltip: Penalty to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls. Hight Pain Threshold halves the penalty while Low Pain Threshold doubles the penalty. See B428.
distraction-tooltip: -1 for Bees in your face, -2 for part clothes on fire, -3 all clothes on fire, etc. See B548.
bad-footing-tooltip: Skill penalty for bad footing. See B547-B549.
defense-bad-footing-tooltip: Defensive penalty for bad footing. See B547-B549.
defense-mounted-tooltip: If mounted, defensive penalty is equal to difference between 12 and Riding skill. See B388
retreating-flight-tooltip: If flyer can hover, add +1 to defense to retreating defense if you can move 1 hex up or down. See B398
grappled-tooltip: See Actions after being grappled for more information. See B371.
shield-close-combat-penalty-label: Close combat with shield: -1 per DB
shield-close-combat-penalty-tooltip: See Shields in Close Combat B392.
visibility-roll-modifier-tooltip: Combined total can't exceed -10 or -6 if used to blindness.
no-visiblity-condition-tooltip: Only affected by darkness, smoke, fog, blur, or other.
cannot-see-anything-tooltip: If used to blindess, penalty is -6. Max skill is 9. See B124 and B394.
darkness-tooltip: -10 is considered total darkness, no light available. See B394.
obscure-vision-tooltip: -10 totally obscures vision. See Obscure B72.
know-location-tooltip: If the foe is in a single smoke-filled hex or the like, no Hearing roll is required and the attack penalty is only -4. Roll for random hit location. Max Skill is 9. B394.
extra-time-tooltip: Working slowly and deliberately on a noncombat task. See B346.
haste-tooltip: Hurrying the noncombat task. See B346.
unfamiliar-culture-tooltip: -3 to skill with a significant cultural component; Carousing, Connoisseur, Criminology, Dancing, Detect Lies, Diplomacy, Fast-Talk, Games, Gesture, etc. See B23.
language-modifier-tooltip:
Based on comprehension, use Task Difficulty for additional modifiers like bad phone connection. See B24.
Language skills: Fast-Talk, Public Speaking, Research, Speed-Reading, teaching, and Writing.
Artistic Skills: Poetry, Singing, etc.
iq-tech-level-modifier-tooltip: IQ-Based skills. When you work with equipment or concepts of a TL different from your own skill, you suffer a penalty. See B168.
non-iq-tech-level-modifier-tooltip: Non IQ-Based skills. Flat penalty of -1 per TL difference. See B168.
available-equipment-tooltip: Equipment modifiers for skills. See B345.
damaged-equipment-tooltip: Damaged equipment modifier, such as -1 for first-aid kit salvaged from a wreck. See B346.
unfamiliar-equipment-tooltip: Any skill used to operate equipment like Driving/TL7 (Autommobile) takes a penalty when faced with an unfamiliar type of item. For instance, you're used to a compact car but you need to drive a van. See B169.
low-mana-tooltip: Only mages can cast spells and all spells are at -5. Critical failures have mild effects or no effect at all. See B235.
burn-hit-points-tooltip: Burn Hit Points instead of FP, but you're -1 to skill per HP. High Pain Threshold has no effect. See B237.
ceremonial-bonus-tooltip:
Ceremonial Magic involves a group of willing assistants. Receive a skill bonus based on how much extra energy you receive.
  • 20% : +1 skill
  • 40% : +2 skill
  • 60% : +3 skill
  • 100% : +4 skill
Add another +1 per additional 100% of required energy.
See B238.
regular-spell-range-tooltip: For regular and area spells apply a penalty of -1 per yard of distance. See B239.
spell-cant-see-touch-tooltip: For regular spells, if you can't see or touch your subject, you're at -5 to skill. See B239.
long-distance-tooltip: Use these modifiers for Information spells that work over long distances, such as Seek spells. Certain advantages use these ranges. If the distance falls between two values, use the higher value. See B241.
attributes-modifier-tooltip:
A modifier that will be applied to your
attribute. All derived attributes draw their
base from your unmodified attributes.
Therefore this MOD will generally only
affect direct attribute rolls and skill rolls.
attributes-strength-tooltip:
Strength 10pts/level - Unmodified
Cost reduced by -10% (Max -80%) per SM+1 (B15)
attributes-perception-tooltip:
Perception: Based on Intelligence
5pts/level
Check the box to whisper perception roll to GM.
Unmodified:
attribute-smell-tooltip:
Smell & Taste Perception (B35)
Based on Perception
2pts/level
Unmodified:
attribute-fright-tooltip:
Fright Check (B360)
Based on Willpower
2pts/level
Unmodified:
See extensive list of Modifiers B360 & GURPS Horror p139-142.
attribute-fright-check-threshold-tooltip:
Fright Check Threshold - Uses Rule of 14 (B360). By default this value is 13.
This means that a roll of 14 or more is automatically a failure.
This Threshold can be modifier by the Perks of Brave (Dungeon Fantasy 11, p11) or Rule of 15
(Power Ups 2, p13).
Will and/or Fright plus bonuses (like Fearlessness or Combat Reflexes) must total 14+ for this
to be useful, of course!
Note: A Fright Check can be used for Awe and Confusion. (Powers p84 under Terror) and the Awe and
Confusion Check Table for failures. (Powers p85).
attribute-unstun-tooltip:
Recover from physical stun, based on Health.
Roll at the end of your turn after Do Nothing.
Fit +1 to roll.Very Fit +2 to roll. See B55.
Unfit -1 to roll. Very Unfit -2 to roll. See B160.
attribute-knock-down-tooltip:
Knockdown & Stunning Check, based on Health.
Roll:
Whenever you suffer a major wound. B420
Whenever you are struck in the head (skull, face, or eye) or
vitals for enough injury to cause a shock penalty,
You must make an immediate HT roll to avoid knockdown and stunning.
>Modifiers:
-5 for a major wound to the face or vitals (or to the groin, on a humanoid male).
-10 for a major wound to the skull or eye.
+3 High Pain Threshold
-4 Low Pain Threshold
attribute-unconscious-check-tooltip:
Unconscious Check, based on Health
If HP zero or less, roll per turn to take an Active Action.
-1 per full multiple of HP below zero.
Hard/Easy to Subdue: Gives +/- per level to Unconscious Check
Fit +1 to Unc. Check . Very Fit +2 to Unc. Check
attribute-death-check-tooltip:
Death Check, based on Health.
On damage taken: Immediately Roll a Death Check if you are
at-1xHP or more.
Roll again each time you suffer injury equal to a further
multiple of your HP. (-2xHP, -3xHP, -4xHP)
Immediate Death at -5xHP
Hard/Easy to Kill: Gives +/- per level to a Death Check
Fit +1 to roll.Very Fit +2 to roll. See B55.
Unfit -1 to roll. Very Unfit -2 to roll. See B160.
attribute-speed-tooltip:
Basic Speed
Based on Health and Dexterity
5pts/0.25
Unmodified:
attribute-move-tooltip:
Basic Move - Based on Basic Speed - 5pts/level - Unmodified:
Note: The Move score automatically adjusts for Encumbrance and for HP and/or FP loss below 1/3. (B419, B426)
attribute-enhanced-ground-move-tooltip:
Enhanced ground move.
10pts per half level. Can use up|down arrow keys
Level:
attribute-dodge-tooltip:
Dodge - Based on Basic Speed - Unmodified:
Note: The Dodge score automatically adjusts for HP and/or FP loss below 1/3. (B419, B426)
attribute-lifting-strength-tooltip:
Lifting Strength (B65)
Based on Strength 3pts/level
Unmodified:
attribute-basic-lift-tooltip: Basic Lift Table B17, in pounds. (B15)
attribute-striking-strength-tooltip:
Striking Strength
Based on Strength
5pts/level
Unmodified:
melee-thrust-tooltip:
Thrust damage based on Striking ST. You can use the macro name in a weapons damage column and apply basic math.
Example:
Damage = @{thrust}+1
attribute-thrust-damage-table:
Thrust Damage
See B16 for the complete table.
StrengthThrust
11d6-6
21d6-6

Swing damage based on Striking ST. You can use the macro name in a weapons damage column and apply basic math.
Example:
Damage = @{swing}+1

maximum-hit-poits-tooltip:
Hit Points - Based on Strength - 2pts/level
Cost reduced by -10% per SM+1 (B15)
current-hit-points-tooltip:
Current Hit Points
When your HP is low, you take penalties. (B419)
current-hit-points-reeling: Reeling: If your HP is less than
current-hit-points-reeling-description:
- Halve Move and Dodge (round up) (B419)
- These effects are cumulative with FP loss. See GURPS FAQ: 3.4.5.7
- Note: This sheet automatically calculates that for you and adjusts those values.
current-hit-points-collaps-description:
- Roll every turn @{VS} HT or fall unconscious.
- Your HT roll is at -1 for every 1xHP you are below 0.
- If you do nothing, and don't defend, you don't have to roll.
current-hit-points-verge-of-death-descri:
- Roll once @{VS} HT to stay alive.
- If you fail by 1 or 2 you are mortally wounded, but not dead. (B423)
- Roll again every time you take injury that puts you below
another multiple of your max HP.
current-hit-points-total-destruction-des: - Your body has been destroyed beyond recognition or resurrection.
hit-points-half-move-tooltip: Move and Dodge is halved due to hit point loss. See B419.
hit-points-fatigue-quartered-move: Move and Dodge is quartered due to hit point and fatigue loss. See B419.
current-fatigue-points-tool-tip:
Current Fatigue Points
When your FP is low you take penalties. (B426)
fatigue-points-tired-label: Tired: If your FP is less than
fatigue-points-tired-description:
- Halve your Move, Dodge, and ST (round up) (B426)
- These effects are cumulative with HP loss. See GURPS FAQ: 3.4.5.7
- Note: This sheet automatically calculates that for you and adjusts
those values – This does not affect ST-based quantities,
such as HP and damage. (B426)
verge-of-collapse-description:
- If you suffer further fatigue, each FP you lose also causes 1 HP of injury. (B426)
- Roll against Will to do anything besides rest or talk.
- If you fail your Will roll, you fall unconscious.
- On a critical failure, roll @{VS} HT or suffer a heart attack.
unconscious-description:
- Immediately fall unconscious
- FP can't drop any lower, but you still lose HP.
- You regain consciousness at 0 FP
half-move-strength-tooltip:
Move, Dodge, and ST are halved due to fatigue loss. See B426.
Affects ST roll and using weapons with minimum ST.
half-strength-tooltip:
ST is halved due to fatigue loss. See B426.
Affects ST roll and using weapons with minimum ST.
maximum-energy-reserve-tooltip:
Energy Reserve
See Dungeon Fantasy 3, pg39 - Introduced
See Powers, pg119 – More detailed
current-energy-reserve-tooltip:
Current Energy Reserve
See Dungeon Fantasy 3, pg39 - Introduced
See Powers, pg119 – More detailed
custom-pools-tooltip:
Add additional energy pools. Enter a name of the pool, max number points, cost in character points, and the current points of pool.
Examples include:
RP (Radiation Threshold Points), see After the End 1, p24. (ST + HT)/2, round down.
LFP (Long Term Fatigue Points), see After the End 1, p24.
simple-lift-heading-tooltip:
The weight the character can lift overhead
with one hand in one second.
one-handed-lift-tooltip:
The weight the character can lift overhead
with one hand in two seconds.
two-handed-lift-tooltip:
The weight the character can lift overhead
with both hands in four seconds.
shove-and-knock-over-tooltip:
The weight of an object the character can
shove and knock over.
running-shove-knock-over-tooltip:
The weight of an object the character can
shove and knock over with a running start.
carry-on-back-tooltip:
The weight the character can carry slung
over his/her back.
shift-slightly-tooltip:
The weight of an object that the character
can shift slightly on a floor.
apply-encumbrance-dodge-note-tooltip: NOTE: The predefined dodges already of encumbrance applied!
show-defense-bonus-tooltip: Show Defense Bonus Notes in roll results.
load-tooltip: Amount of weight you're currently carrying.
encumbrance-move-score-tooltip:
Note: The Move score automatically adjusts for Encumbrance
and for HP and/or FP loss below 1/3. (B419, B426)
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
enhanced-move-tooltip:
Enhanced ground move.
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
air-tooltip:
Air/Flying move.
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
water-tooltip:
Water/Swimming move.
STEP: The number in parentheses is the step distance.
encumbrance-dodge-tooltip:
Note: The Dodge score automatically adjusts for Encumbrance
and for HP and/or FP loss below 1/3. (B419, B426)
encumbrance-maximum-load-tooltip:
Carry on Back (B353) 15xBL. Thus, you can carry
more than you can lift by yourself . . . but
every second that your encumbrance is over 10xBL
(that is Extra-Heavy encumbrance), you lose 1 FP.
turning-velocity-movement-tooltip: Select movement type to determine turning radius and/or deceleration penalty.
start-velocity-tooltip:
Enter velocity (yards/second) for current turn.
Important: Be sure to check your max allowed velocity based on movement type.
change-in-velocity-tooltip:
Amount to accelerate or decelerate for the turn. See B395.
NOTE: Max deceleration is 2 times your basic move.
final-velocity-tooltip:
Final velocity. Current Velocity - Deceleration.
The final velocity is how you start the turn and is used to
calculate the deceleration penalty, turn radius, and tight turn penalty.
deceleration-penalty-tooltip:
Deceleration Skill penalty to DX roll or operation skill.
Example: Moving 12/second, need to slow to 5/second, deceleration = 12 - 5 = 7.
Can safely decelerate up to base move, no roll needed.
If over safe deceleration, then make DX+3. If in vehicle, use operation skill + handling statistic.
Apply the appropriate skill penalty from the input forms to the right.
How it works: -1 per two full yards/second beyond Basic Move by which you cut your speed.
NOTE: make an additional roll if you're also turning.
Example: Car with move 3/57 traveling at 16 yards/second, needs to decelerate to 6 yards/second.
Driving Skill: 12, Handling: 0.
Total Deceleration = 16 - 6 = 10.
Can safely decelerate to 16 - 3 (base move) = 13.
Penalty = 13 - 6 (goal speed) / 2 = -3.
Making Driving Skill 12 - 3 to succeed.
see B395.
turn-radius-tooltip:
Turn Radius. Minimum number of hexes to move before making a 60° facing change.
Turn Radius = (Final Velocity / Base Move Score) rounded down.
Example: Super Run = 6/24. Final Velocity = 18. Turn Radius = 18/6 = 3.
See B394.
tight-turn-tooltip:
Tight Turn Skill Penalty. Allows you to make an additional facing change.
120° facing change instead of 60°.
Penalty = -1 per full increment of base move which your velocity exceeds your Basic Move.
See B395.
flight-tooltip:
Check the box to add Flight (B56) to the character.
This will update the Air movement column for the encumbrance table.
Use the text box to enter the number of character points used for Flight
air-move-tooltip:
Base Air Move = Basic Speed * 2 =
2pts/level, you can use up and down arrows
enhanced-air-move-tooltip:
Enhanced Air Move
Modifier box: steps of .5, you can use up and down arrows.
Points box: 10 points per half-level, you can use up and down arrows.
Each level doubles top air move. Half-level is a multiple of 1.5.
Level:
amphibious-tooltip:
Amphibious: Check the box to apply Amphibious (B40) to character
This will update the swimming movement on the encumbrance table.
water-move-tooltip:
Basic Move =
Formula = Basic Move / 5 or Basic Move if amphibious.
5pts/level, you can use up and down arrows.
NOTE: Max +2 water move if you have swimming skill.
enhanced-water-move-tooltip:
Enhanced Water Move
Modifier box: steps of .5, you can use up and down arrows.
Points box: 10 points per half-level, you can use up and down arrows.
Each level doubles top water move. Half-level is a multiple of 1.5.
Level:
jump-skill-tooltip: Jump Skill: If entered, automatically calculates using Jump Skill/2 (rounded down)instead of Basic Move to calculate jumping distances. B352
jumping-use-strength-tooltip:
Check this box if using this Optional Rule B352.
If Basic Lift () > body weight, use ST/4 instead of Move or Jump skill.
super-jump-tooltip:
Super Jump: use this if you have the Super Jump as an Advantage. B89
1st column will show your modifier based on the entries for the 2nd and 3rd columns.
2nd column is the Modifier box: steps of 1, you can use the up and down arrows to change the value.
3rd column is the Points box: 10points per level, you can use the up and down arrows to change the value. Each level doubles the jump distance.
encumbrance-tooltip: Current encumbrance level. Penalty equal to your encumbrance is applied to Dodge, Judo, Karate, or any fencing Parry. See B549
jump-encumbrance-penalty-tooltip:
Apply encumbrance penalty. See B352
1 for None, 0.8 for Light, 0.6 for Medium, 0.4 for Heavy, and 0.2 for Extra-Heavy.
jump-preparation-tooltip:
Check this box if you took 2 consecutive Concentration maneuvers to prepare.
Leave unchecked otherwise, in which case you will halve all jump distances. B352
standing-broad-jump-tooltip:
Standing Broad Jump Distance. B352
1st column will either show be (2 x Stat to use) – 3 feet or your Jump Skill/2 (rounded down).
2nd column shows you how many feet you may jump.
3rd column shows you how many yards you jump.
Formula = (2 x Stat To use) - 3 feet
Stat to use:
running-broad-jump-tooltip:
Running Broad Jump Distance, under Broad Jump description. B352
1st column enter how may yards you ran this turn.
2nd column shows you how many feet you may jump.
3rd column shows you how many yard you jump.
Formula = (2 x Stat To use) - 3 feet
Stat to use:
Max running broad jump distance is twice standing broad jump distance.
high-jump-tooltip:
High Jump Distance. B352
1st column will either be (6 x Stat to use) – 10 inches or your Jump Skill/2 (rounded down).
2nd column shows you how many feet you may jump.
3rd column shows you how many yard you jump.
Formula = (6 x Stat To use) - 10 inches
Stat to use:
running-high-jump-tooltip:
Running High Jump Distance, under High Jump. B352.
1st column enter in your (6 x Stat To use) plus how may yards you ran this turn.
2nd column shows how many feet you may jump straight up.
3rd column shows how many yards you jump straight up.
Formula = (6 x Stat To use) - 10 inches
Stat to use:
Max running high jump distance is twice standing high jump distance.
jump-move-tooltip:
Jump move. This is actually the ‘Super Jump’ value for that Advantage. See B89
Greater of Broad Jump Yards / 5 OR Normal Ground Move.
point-summary-tooltip:
Total: Manual input: Represents total value of the
PC in Character Points (spent & unspent combined).
Spent: Automatic total of Spent points:
Attributes + Traits + Skills + Other.
Unspent: Has the option of being Manual or
Automatic, depending on an option selected on the
Settings page entitled ‘Enter Unspent Points’.
Manual Mode (Blue color): You manually enter your
Unspent points.
Automatic mode (Black color): It calculates the
point total difference between Total and Spent.
point-total-tooltip:
Total: Manual input: Represents total value of the
PC in Character Points (spent and unspent combined).
gca-format-tooltip:
GURPS Character Assistant (GCA) Format
To change to GCS or Detailed go to options tab
and change the radio button for Point Summary Layout
gcs-format-format-tooltip:
GURPS Character Sheet (GCS) format
To change to GCA or Detailed go to options tab
and change the radio button for Point Summary Layout
detailed-format-tooltip:
To change to GCA or GCS go to options tab
and change the radio button for Point Summary Layout
points-summary-for-attributes-tooltip:
Point Summary for:
ST, DX, IQ, HT,
HP, FP, Energy Reserve One, Two, and Three,
Per, Vision, Hearing, Smell, Touch,
Will, Fright, Unconsciousness, Death,
Speed, Move, Lift ST, Striking ST,
Flying, Air Move, Enhanced Air Move, Super Jump
gca-point-summary-for-advantages-tooltip:
Point Summary for:
Languages, Tech Level, Cultural Familiarities,
Advantages, and Racial traits.
gcs-point-summary-for-advantages-tooltip:
Point Summary for:
Languages, Tech Level, Cultural Familiarities,
Advantages, and Perks.
detailed-point-summary-for-advantages-to:
Point Summary for:
Languages, Tech Level, Cultural Familiarities,
and Advantages.
technology-level-tooltip:
This is the technology level that your character is familiar with.
It costs 5 points to raise this above or below the campaign's
normal TL.
TL0Stone Age (Prehistory and later).
TL1Bronze Age (3500 B.C.+).
TL2Iron Age (1200 B.C.+).
TL3Medieval (600 A.D.+).
TL4Age of Sail (1450+).
TL5Industrial Revolution (1730+).
TL6Mechanized Age (1880+).
TL7Nuclear Age (1940+).
TL8Digital Age (1980+).
TL9Microtech Age (2025+?).
TL10Robotic Age (2070+?).
TL11Age of Exotic Matter.
TL12+Whatever the GM likes!
frequency-of-appearance-tooltip:
Frequency of Appearance
15 or less>
12 or less>
9 or less>
6 or less>
book-reference-tooltip:
Reference to book and page numbers.
Examples:
B238 = GURPS Basic, Page 238
PU2:126 = Power-Ups 2. Page 126
modifier-dialog-tooltip:
Enter a modifier to apply to any rolls on the this table.
Use the pencil/paper icon to select modifiers.
NOTE: Changing the modifier or check status of Max skill of 9 will clear modifiers used by dialog box.
show-notes-below-label: Show notes below in roll template
show-skill-mod-notes-below-label: Show Skill Modifier notes (refer to the actual skill description)
self-control-number-tooltip:
Self-control Number OR
Frequency of Appearance
15 or less
12 or less
9 or less
6 or less
size-modifier-tooltip: For more information see B15, B16, B19. Note: use the Apply checkbox to use Size Modify limitations to Strength and Extra Hit Points.
apply-size-modifier-tooltip:
If checked, character point costs for Strength and Hit Points will be modified.
See B15, B16, B19
reach-modifier-tooltip:
Reach Modifier.
See Size Modifier and Reach, B402
When grappling, you get +1 To Hit per size modifier difference.
character-weight-tooltip:
Enter a Numerical Value only.
Do not enter any type of indicator like lbs, pounds, kilos, etc.
This is because the weight is added to your Inventory’s Grand Total
Weight and thus needs to be numerical.
physical-appearance-tooltip: The appearance drop-down is for reference. If there's a point cost, please enter your appearance and cost onthe Traits tab under Advantages or Disadvantages.
scars-tattooe-etc-tooltip: Scars, tattoos, distinguishing marks or features.
stash-money-location-tooltip: Total available cash stashed in banks, vaults, mattresses, etc.
training-tooltip:
Training rules can be found at ‘Improvement
Through Study’ B292.
Advanced rules can be found in Social
Engineering: Back to School.
active-defense-formula-tooltip: Formula is based upon the active defense type.
formula-as-is-description: Enter a value or use the linked item value as is.
skill-modifier-tooltip:
Modifier applied to skill level.
Can be a positive or a negative number.
Examples include a bonus from a Talent,
default from another Skill or Technique,
a piece of equipment, or a Perk.
row-id-tooltip:
The row id can be used with macros.
Example field name: repeating_skills_[the row id]_level
This example would represent the skill level on that row.
melee-row-id-tooltip:
Use the melee row id to link an active defense to this melee attack.
This allows you to use your enhanced skill with this weapon for parries.
reason-for-modifiers-skills-tooltip:
Examples:
+1 from Talent...
+1 from Default Skill...
+1 from Enchanted Item with...
custom-success-fail-notes-tooltip:
Success, critical success, fail, and critical fail
notes will be added to roll results.
You can add macros to these notes.
The width of these note boxes are set to help you
visualize what it will look like in chat.
techniques-legacy-tooltip:
New Optional Feature Available.
A revised techniques table is available by setting the options on the character sheet.
This revised techniques is not final, we'll make adjustments based upon feedback.
New Legacy and Revised Technique Tables. Options to show/hide the Legacy
Techniques table and the new Revised Techniques table.
Show both tables if you want to transfer your current techniques to the new table.
If old technique table has no rows, then hide old table, show new table.
base-skill-level-tooltip:
Base skill level of technique, usually
based on Parent Skill.
see Techniques B229
techniques-revised-default-tooltip:
Default modifier to apply to the base skill.
For example, Kicking is -2 from Brawling or Karate Skill.
Enter 0 if there is no modifier.
see Techniques B229
techniques-revised-maximum-modifier-tool:
Maximum modifier allowed for the technique.
This is relative to the parent skill.
For example, Kicking cannot exceed Brawling + 0
or Karate + 0.
see Techniques B229
technique-difficulty-tooltip:
Difficulty of technique.
Feats with severe consequences on a failure
or allow only one attempt are Hard.
see Techniques B229
row-id-repeating-tooltip:
The row id can be used with macros.
Example field name: repeating_techniquesrevised_[the row id]_level
This example would represent the skill level on that row.
link-to-row-id-tooltip: Link this row to another row item.
copy-paste-row-id-tooltip:
Copy/paste the Skill or Spell Row ID to link that skill to this technique.
When the skill/spell is updated, the technique's parent name and base skill level
will be updated.
Once entered, this will change the Skill/Spell for this particular attack to match
the skill/spell level of the Base Skill. Do not change this skill Level number manually.
hit-location-tooltip:
Basic Table B552.
Optinal: Rules
New Hit Locations
LT100-103, MA137
hit-location-penalty-tooltip:
This is the Penalty
applied to attack the
specific location.
damage-resistance-tooltip:
Low-Tech #/# usually means All Attack Types / Except
this specific Type of attack.
Example: Enter as 3/2cr* means DR3 vs all attacks
except cr which uses DR2. * means it is Flexible
armor (B379).
High-Tech and Ultra-Tech #/# usually mean against
these Type Attacks / All other Attack Types.
Example: Enter as 5imp, cr /2 means DR5 vs imp and
cr type of attacks and DR2 against all other types
of attacks.
activate-custom-roll-modifier-tooltip:
You can turn on the custom modifiers by going to
Sheet Options Tab then to Skill Modifier Tools
and checking the tools to use.
update-hit-points-tooltip: If checked, when applying damage to a location, current Hit Points is updated.
active-defense-type-tooltip:
Changing the Type will also update success/fail notes
for that active defense.
Parry, Block, and Block have default notes that can be
changed on the options page.
NOTE Changing the Type will clear any previous notes
you entered.
active-defense-information-tooltip:
F: this is a fencing weapon.
U: the weapon is unbalanced. You cannot use it to
parry if you've already attacked with it this turn
(and vice versa).
half-dodge-tooltip: Dodge is halved due to hit points or fatigue loss. See B418 or B426.
quarter-dodge-tooltip: Dodge is quartered due to hit points and fatigue loss. See B418 or B426.
custom-notes-active-defense-tooltip: Add custom notes for this active defense.
dodge-retreat-versus-melee-label: Dodge and Retreat (vs. Melee Attacks Only)
dodge-retreat-versus-melee-tooltip:
Against a Melee Attack ONLY. (B377). It cannot be used against Ranged Attacks.
Optional Rules for Retreat can be found in MA123.
dodge-drop-ranged-label: Dodge and Drop (vs. Ranged Attacks only)
dodge-drop-ranged-tooltip:
Dodge and Drop (Also 'Sacrificial Dodge and Drop', and 'Diving for Cover').
It is similar to a Dodge and Retreat, but only effective against Ranged Attacks. (B377)
knockback-label: Knockback save vs crushing or cutting attacks
knockback-tooltip:
A crushing attack can cause knockback regardless of whether it penetrates DR.
A cutting attack can cause knockback only if it fails to penetrate DR.
For every full ST-2 damage (BEFORE subtracting DR) target is moved yard away from attacker.
NOTE: If target has no ST score (like a wall) or is not resisting, use HP instead.

If knocked back, Roll against DX, Acrobatics, or Judo.
-1 per yard of knockback AFTER the first yard.
+4 for Perfect Balance. see B378.
If target collides with an object, use yards knocked back to calculate Collisions and Falls (see Combat Tools).
knockback-hitpoints-modifier-tooltip:
Modify the number of hit points required for knockback.
For skinny, special rules, etc.
fencing-unbalanced-tooltip:
If you enter F or U under the INFO column, the notes
below will be replaced with appropriate notes.
Any other value, and the text box will get cleared out.
apply-combat-reflexes-tooltip: Quickly add +1 Dodge modifier and +2 Fright modifier on the General page. (B43)
defense-bonus-notes-tooltip:
Examples:
+2 DB for Torso (Front Only), Skull, Neck, Hands, Head (1/6 Face), and Feet. Armor Enchantment: Deflect.
+1 DB SHIELD SIDE (Left): from Small Shield.
+1 DB for Rear only - (All but head unless hood is up). From Heavy Cloak.
melee-attack-damage-tooltip:
For an Armor Divisor: A number in parenthesis after
the damage - eg. (2) - is an armor divisor.
Enter this number in the Damage Notes as AD(#) or as
Armor Divisor(#).
ex: indicates the attack causes an explosion.
See B269. Enter in the Damage Notes
Tip: You can enter @{thrust} or @{swing} into the damage field.
You can do simple math with this macro.
Example: @{thrust}+1
melee-reach-tooltip:
The distance in yards that the weapon can reach.
C: this weapon can be used in close combat.
*: the weapon is awkward, and requires a Ready
maneuver to switch between different reaches.
close-reach-tooltip:
A reach C weapon increases to reach 1, but no other effects.
See Size Modifier and Reach, B402
modifier-tooltip:
Enter the net value of all modifiers combined.
Can be a positive or a negative number.
Example: Enter 2 for Weapon’s Bond (+1) plus Magic (Accuracy: +1).
Once entered, this will change the Skill/Spell Level for this particular
weapon to match the Base Skill/Spell level plus this MOD (Modifier).
Do not change this level number manually.
melee-weapon-notes-tooltip:
Hint: Enter inline rolls for additional results. To show the selected arrow.
Example: Select Location: ?{Location|Head|Torso}
melee-damage-notes-tooltip:
Hint: Enter inline rolls for additional results.
Example: Does an additional [[1d6]] fire damage.
firing-upward-tooltip: For firing Upward or Downward - See B407.
ranged-damage-tooltip:
For an Armor Divisor: A number in parenthesis after
the damage - eg. (2) - is an armor divisor.
Enter this number in the Damage Notes as AD(#) or as
Armor Divisor(#).
ex: indicates the attack causes an explosion.
[#d]: indicates the attack causes fragmentation.
See B269. Enter in the Damage Notes
Tip: You can enter @{thrust} or @{swing} into the damage field.
You can do simple math with this macro.
Example: @{thrust}+1
rate-of-fire-tooltip:
Rate of Fire
The maximum number of shots that can be fired in
one turn (by a regular person).
The minimum number of shots is 1.

!: minimum RoF is 1/4 of the maximum, rounded up.
mxn: fires the first number of shots, which each then
split into the second number (eg. shotguns)
Jet: shoots a continuous stream of fluid. See page 106.
shots-tooltip:
The number of shots that can be fired before the
weapon must be reloaded.
The parenthetical number indicates the number of 1
second ready maneuvers required to reload the
weapon.
T: the weapon is thrown. To "reload" it, pick it up.
i: you must load the shots individually. the listed
time is for each shot.
bulk-tooltip:
Move and Attack: If you are making a ranged attack,
you have a penalty of -2 or the weapon’s Bulk rating,
whichever is worse (B365, B469, B548).
Close Combat: If using a ranged weapon, ignore the usual
speed/range penalty and apply the weapon’s Bulk
statistic as a penalty to hit. B391
It also serves as a penalty to Holdout skill when you
attempt to conceal the weapon. B370
recoil-tooltip:
When firing at RoF 2+, every full multiple of Rcl
by which you make your attack roll means you score
one extra hit, to a maximum number of hits equal
to total shots fired. See page 373.
malfunction-tooltip:
Malfunction is an Optional Rule. B278, B279, B382, tables B407 & HT179, with more detailed info HT79-81. If the option Use Malfunction is
checked [see Sheet Options page], and if the # entered here is greater than 0, then the roll result will check for weapon malfunction.
Malfunction has "priority" over a critical miss: if both would occur, only the malfunction takes place. See Critical Misses B382.
verify-malfunction-tooltip: If Verify is checked, then roll again to verify the malfunction. see HT79
armor-divisor-tooltip:
Divide the target's armor DR by this number before subtracting damage
or (adding it adding it to the HT roll for an affliction). See B268.
Explosive attacks (optional house rule: area effect attacks) only apply divisor to target of direct hit. See B269.
Afflictions divide the armor DR before determining bonus to HT roll. See B269
ranged-weapon-notes-tooltip:
Hint: Enter inline rolls for additional results. To show the selected arrow.
Example: Arrow: ?{Arrow Type|Bodkin|Normal}
ranged-damage-notes-tooltip:
Hint: Enter inline rolls for additional results.
Example: Does an additional [[1d6]] fire damage.
thrown-strength-tooltip:
Based on Striking ST
Note: future versions will add ability to choose ST source or enter ST.
thrown-modifier-tooltip:
Bonus or penalty per die
Throwing Art at DX Level = +1 per die
Throwing Art at DX+1 Level = +2 per die
thrown-super-tooltip:
Super Throw Level
Each level of Super Throw, double range.
Each level of Super Throw increases damage by +2 per die.
thrown-damage-tooltip: Final damage based on ST, super throw, and damage modifier.
throwing-range-tooltip: See GURPS Campaigns Page 355 for formula
firing-up-down-range-tooltip:
Distance between shooter and target.
See B372-373
firing-up-down-speed-tooltip:
(2 mph = 1 yard/second).
Ignore if human like target moving 10 yards or less.
See B372-373
target-ranged-size-modifier-tooltip: Size Modifier of target. The modifier is applied AFTER location, grapple, shield, chinks in armor have been applied.
target-melee-size-modifier-tooltip:
Size Modifier of target, which will then be substracted by your size modifier (SM ) to get a final Relative Size Modifier.

For information see http://sjgames.com/gurps/faq/FAQ4-3.html#SS3.4.2.23

The modifier is applied AFTER location, grapple, shield, chinks in armor have been applied.
firing-up-down-position-tooltipo:
Your vertical position relative to the target.
Ignore up/down for beam type weapons like lasers.
See FIRING UPWARD AND DOWNWARD B407.
Firing downward decreases distance.
For every 2 yards above your target, subtract 1 from distance.
Firing upward increases distance.
Example: Distance 40 yards, you are 10 yards above the target, so subtract 5 yards. Final distance is 35 yards.
For every 1 yard below> your target, add 1 to distance.
Example: Distance 40 yards, you are 10 yards below the target, so add 10 yards. Final distance is 50 yards.
firing-up-down-elevation-tooltip: The number of yards you are above or below the target.
ranged-elevation-label:
If you're above the target, enter a positive number of hexes.
If you're below the target, enter a negative number of hexes.
See B407.
effective-speed-range-tooltip: Effective speed/range based on range, speed, and elevation.
apply-firing-tooltip:
Apply this modifier to the ranged Modifier box and Roll Modifiers tool.
Important This will replace any current modifiers.
falling-velocity-tooltip:
If collision, use relative velocity.
Head-on collision = Add velocity of both objects
Rearend collision = Faster object - slower object
Side collision = Speed of object causing collision
falling-hit-points-tooltip:
Hit Points of falling object or object initiating
collision.
If hitting immovable object, use HP*2
NOTE: If collision, if the other object is moving
it will inflict its own damage to object that initiated
the collision.
See B430
select-token-tooltip:
Click the button to turn on select a token before a skill roll.
The token name will appear in the results.
Note: More advanced features will require using Roll20's API.
target-token-tooltip:
Click the button to turn on target a token before a skill roll.
The token name will appear in the results.
Note: More advanced features will require using Roll20's API.
demolition-select-tooltip: Select an explosion type to use. This will populate Type and REF fields.
relative-explosive-force-tooltip:
Relative Explosive Force, equivalence in pounds of TNT.
TNT = 1.0. See B415.
demolition-pounds-tooltip: Weight in pounds required by its REF.
demolition-base-damage-tooltip: Base damage role. Rules as written is 6d6.
damage-multiplier-tooltip:
Damage Multiplier:
Enter the number to multiply 6d6 by.
An explosion doing 6dxn damage takes (nxn)/4 pounds of TNT.
NOTE: Anyone caught in a blast may attempt an active defense
roll to dive for cover from the explosion’s collateral damage and
fragmentation; see Dodge and Drop B377.
radius-collateral-damage-tooltip:
Radius of collateral damage. See B414
For instance, if an explosion does 6dx2 damage,
everyone within 24 yards is vulnerable.

For fragmentation damage, the radius is
5 x dice of fragmentation damage.
demolition-armor-devisor-tooltip:
Divisor. Amount to divide damage by based on
distance from blast. See B414
You can enter: 3 (default), 2, or 1.
Default: Damage rolled / (3 x distance blast).
Damage Modifiers Explosion, see B104.
Exp. +100% = Damage rolled / (2 x distance from blast).
Exp. +150% = Damage rolled / (1 x distance from blast).
demolition-target-tooltip:
Target's distance from center of blast.
Damage / (3 x distance from blast). Round down.
See B414
demolition-how-much-tooltip:
Determine how much explosive to use based on damage. TNT = 1.0
See B415.
demolition-how-big-tooltip:
Determine how big the explosion is based on weight.
See B415.
fragmentation-skill-tooltip:
Base skill level for a fragmentation damage to hit a target.
A hit is automatic if the explosive attack actually strikes the target.
Only three modifiers apply: the range modifier for the distance from the center
of the blast to the target, the modifier for the target’s posture (prone, etc.),
and the target’s Size Modifier. It is possible for several fragments to hit! For
every three points by which the attack roll succeeds, one additional fragment
strikes the target.
shotgun-notes-description: Enter the stats of the shotgun, be sure to use half-damage range. The tool will calculate how close you need to be with the shotgun, the RoF, close range damage, and DR multiplier.For more information, see B409.
inventory-carried-tooltip:
Carried
Is the item being carried at the moment?
gravity-tooltip:
Standard gravity is based on 1G, earth normal. See B350.
If gravity is over 1G, then add your weight and encumberance then multiply by Gravity - 1. Add this value to your encumbrance.
If gravity is less than 1G, multiply the weight of your gear by the Gravity value, this is your new encumbrance.
Important: For accurate results please enter your weight on the Bio\Misc tab.
Note: This modifier will be applied to the Total Inventory Weight which affects Encumbrance Level,
it will not be applied to Grand Total Weight since that weight is applied to another person/transport.
gravity-thrown-tooltip: Gravity, affects throwing distance. See B350.
total-inventory-value-tooltip: Total monetary value of all items (carried or not).
total-inventory-weight-tooltip:
Total weight of all items carried.
Note: Gravity will be factored into final weight.
grand-total-weight-tooltip:
Grand total of PC's weight: , and all items carried.
Note:Does not include gravity modifier.
cocentration-penalty-tooltip:
Concentration
spell penalty
Number of spells: .
NOTE: Use options tab to adjust the penalty.
spell-skill-level-modifier-tooltip:
Modifier applied to skill level.
Can be a positive or a negative number.
Examples include a bonus from a Talent,
default from another Skill or Technique,
a piece of equipment, or a Perk.
spell-is-on-tooltip:
Enter a 1 or more to mark as ON
skill penalty for each spell that is ON.
See B238 or M10.
Click one at a time, wait until each penalty is applied before clicking the next one.
spell-concentration-tooltip:
Enter a 1 or more to mark the spell as Under Concentration.
skill penalty for each spell.
See B238 or M10.
Click one at a time, wait until each penalty is applied before clicking the next one.
spell-energy-cost-tooltip: Energy cost for casting the spell.
spell-casting-time-tooltip: Amount of time to cast the spell.
spell-cost-to-maintain-tooltip: Energy cost to maintain the spell.
spell-class-tooltip:
Spell class; Area, Blocking, Information, Melee,
Missile, Regular, Regular (Jet), Resisted, Special
show-spell-modifier-notes-label: Show Spell Modifier notes (see actual spell description)
no-modifier-prompt-tooltip: Rolls will be made immediately with no prompt.
single-modifier-prompt-tooltip:
Ask for a bonus or penalty to be added to dice rolls.
This will not affect damage rolls.
extended-modifier-prompt-tooltip:
Instead of a single modifier, rolls will ask for a series of modifiers,
to remind you about potential bonuses/penalties.
This will not affect damage rolls.
use-skill-modifier-tool-tooltip: Displays a modifier text box, a button to open a tool to modify effective skill, and to check off Max skill of 9.
public-rolls-tooltip:
All players will be able to see
your skill level, roll and results.
private-skill-levels-tooltip:
Only the GM will be able to see
your skill level, but all players
will see the result.
NOTE: This now behaves just like Private Rolls
private-rolls-tooltip:
Only the GM will see your skill
level and the result.
custom-rolls-tooltip:
Use this option to use a custom macro with the Roll Template.

Enter a Button Name if you're displaying the custom roll in the header.
display-in-header-tooltip: If checked, the options for Public Rolls and Private Rolls will be displayed to the right of the character name above the navigation tabs.
display-custom-in-header-tooltip: If checked, button name for Custom Rolls will be displayed to the right of the character name above the tabs.
display-modifier-in-header-label: Display Roll Modifier Options in Header
display-modifier-in-header-tooltip: If checked, the options for No Modifier Prompt, Single Modifier Prompt and Extended Modifier Prompts will be displayed to the right of the character name above the tabs.
macro-label-tooltip:
NOTE: In order to use this option, you will need an API script that can intercept the data for the roll and then send a message to the GM.

For an example, see the Blind Roll API script, https://app.roll20.net/forum/permalink/5064809/
point-summary-detailed-tooltip:
Custom view displaying each section total.
Including the deprecated Misc. Points box.
enter-unspent-points-tooltip: Check if you would like to manually track your unspent points
public-speed-tracker-tooltip: Show basic speed and add to Chat message to public.
private-speed-tracker-tooltip: Show basic speed and add to Chat message to GM.
spell-options-table:
Penalty for each spell ON:
Penalty for each spell Concentrated On:
Show casting details on roll template:
abbreviation-show-rules-as-written-notes: Show Rules as Written Success/Fail notes
use-malfunction-tooltip: If checked, roll results will check for malfunction.
modifiers-to-attributes-increase-all-lab: Mods to attributes increase all derived stats (including HP, FP)
modifiers-to-attributes-increase-most-la: Mods to attributes increase most derived stats (not HP, FP)
modifiers-to-attributes-increase-none-la: Mods to attributes do not increase derived stats
sheet-style-description: Selects a visual style for the character sheet
editable-wound-modifier-notes-descriptio: Initial wound modifier notes based on GURPS 4th Edition - Campaigns
rolltemplate-minimum-damage-description:
Applied to Target's DR
See B378 Damage Roll
ranged-critical-miss-by-10-description: Critical miss by 10 or more doesn't apply to ranged weapons. See B382
rolltemplate-warning-less-than-three-des: WARNING: You may not attempt a success roll if your effective skill (Target) is less than 3. (See B345)
rolltemplate-verify-malfunction-descript: Verify! roll 3d6 again to verify the results. See HT79.
rolltemplate-malfunction-description:
For effect, Roll 3d6 and see table on B407 or use custom table.
NOTE: Malfunction has priority over a critical miss: if both would occur, only the malfunction takes place. Critical Misses, Basic Set, page 382.
back-armor-tooltip: Show back armor for each layer.
character-armor-type-tooltip:
Select the hit location template and click the Apply button.
ALERT: This will delete the current hit locations!
armor-layers-tooltip: Select the number of armor layers to display.
armor-penalty-tooltip:
Penalty to hit this location.
NOTE: Size Modifier is factored in when Applying location type or changing Size Modifier.
armor-layor-tooltip:
Enter DR for this location.
Pattern: [H#] BASE-DR(/SPLIT-DR)* pi, cut
[H#] # is the hardened level of armor. This will NOT be placed on the summary tab.
BASE-DR is the primary DR of the armor, it should always be first.
SPLIT-DR is the armor that have different values based on damage type.
* = flexible armor
Example:[H1] 4/12* pi, cut
H1 = One level hardened. Flexible armor with base DR of 4, but DR 12 against piercing and cutting.
Damage Types: pi, burn, cor, cr, fat, toxic, cut, imp (see B379.)
IMPORTANT: To enter a split DR, the first number must be the primary DR, while the second number are the exceptions, this is required in order to know how to split the armor.
NOTE: Only one layer per row may have split armor.
armor-layor1-tooltip: Layer 1 (Inner most) is good for natural DR or concealable armor, such as cloth armor under a breastplate.
armor-layor2-tooltip: Layer 2 is good for your primary armor, like helmet, leather armor, gloves, etc.
armor-layor3-tooltip: Layer 3 is good for force shields, magic DR, etc.
armor-layor4-tooltip: Layer 4 (Outer most) is also good for force shields, magic DR, etc.
armor-summary-tooltip:
This sums up each layer, from layer 1 (inner) to layer 4 (outer).
* = flexible armor.
Alert: Only one layer per row may have split armor.
hitlocation-damage-tooltip:
Enter the amount of damage this location has taken.
NOTE: The damage will note affect the current Hit Points.
hitlocation-divisor-tooltip: Hit Point Divisor. If the number is 2 or higher, that means the location can be disabled and a value will be updated in the next column. See B421.
hitlocation-disabled-tooltip:
Disabled/Crippled Threshold.
If a single injury meets or exceeds this value, the extremity or structure is disabled.
NOTE: In most cases, if disabled/crippled in one injury, the excess damage is lost, except where noted, such as the eyes.
Dismemberment: If injury is twice the threshold, then extremity is destroyed. Cutting or Explosion will sever the limb.
See B421
hitlocation-wounds-tooltip:
Enter individual wounds here, if limb is crippled, bleeding, etc.
Example: -6 pi (major wound), -2 burn.
major-wounds-tooltip:
Major wound threshold. Any single injury greater than 1/2 your HP.
If using hit location, any injury that disables a limb is a Major Wound.
Roll HT to avoid Knockdown and Stunning or use the K Down trait on the general tab. See B420.
hit-location-notes-tooltip:
Enter notes and traits here.
You could damage notes for Unliving, Homogenous, Diffuse, Unbreakable Bones, Damage Reduction see B380 and Powers 52.
import-notes-tooltip: Import notes into Bio\Misc fields and into Notes textboxes for repeating tables.
size-modifier-strength-warning-message: Warning! Due to your Size Modifier you only need to spend character points for Strength. You may want to adjust the character points.
size-modifier-hit-point-warning-message: Warning! Due to your Size Modifier you only need to spend character points for Extra Hit Points. You may want to adjust the character points.
